title: 15 Natural Methods to Straighten Your Hair for Good

steps.title: Whole or coconut milk straighten and nourish your hair.
steps.content: Whole or coconut milk straighten and nourish your hair. Pour the milk into a spray bottle and spritz it from the roots to the ends of your hair. Gently tug the ends of your hair straight for 20 minutes. Shampoo and condition as normal. [1] X Research source You can use any type of milk (except almond milk), but whole or coconut milk works the best. [2] X Research source Apply a milk mask once a week. Milk contains fats and whey that can strengthen your hair, stimulate hair growth, and straighten frizzy strands. [3] X Research source This mask works best for wavy hair and may not provide the same benefits for curly hair. [4] X Research source Stir 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of honey into the milk for extra shiny hair. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Coconut milk and lemon juice can promote shiny, straight hair.
steps.content: Coconut milk and lemon juice can promote shiny, straight hair. Add 1 ⁄ 2 cup (120 ml) coconut milk and 2 tablespoons (30 ml) fresh lemon juice into a jar and seal it tightly. Put the jar in your fridge and let it separate overnight. [6] X Research source Work the white liquid on top into your hair, then apply the clear liquid from the bottom. Wrap your hair with a towel or silk wrap for 1 hour before washing with shampoo and conditioner. Repeat this treatment once a week. [7] X Research source Hair absorbs vitamin C from the lemon juice and fats from the coconut milk so curls look straighter and more weighed down. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Aloe vera can restore, soften, and straighten your hair.
steps.content: Aloe vera can restore, soften, and straighten your hair. Slice open 3 aloe leaves and scrape out the pulp. Apply it directly to the middle and ends of your hair and let it sit for 10 to 15 minutes. [9] X Research source If your hair is thick, mix the pulp with 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of water. Wash the aloe out with shampoo and conditioner. Apply this mask 2 to 3 times a week. Fresh aloe leaves work best, but you can use store-bought gel instead. To add fragrance, mix in a few drops of rosewater .

steps.title: Apply a paste of equal parts banana and papaya to straighten your hair.
steps.content: Apply a paste of equal parts banana and papaya to straighten your hair. Mash an equal amount of banana and papaya together in a bowl to create a smooth paste. [10] X Research source Apply the paste to your hair and let it sit for 45 minutes. Wash it out with cool water and shampoo. The natural oils and potassium in bananas support hair elasticity, while the vitamin A in papayas can strengthen your hair and prevent breakage. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Eggs and olive oil can straighten your hair and give it some shine.
steps.content: Eggs and olive oil can straighten your hair and give it some shine. Beat 2 eggs and add 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of olive oil. Dampen your hair and work in the egg with your fingers from the roots to the ends. [12] X Research source Leave in the mixture for about an hour, then rinse with shampoo and cold water—hot water could cook the eggs. Apply this egg treatment once a month. For dry or brittle hair, use egg whites and yolks. If your hair feels oily, only apply the whites. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Cornstarch paste can detangle your hair so frizz and waves disappear.
steps.content: Cornstarch paste can detangle your hair so frizz and waves disappear. Mix 2 cups (470 ml) of water and 2 tablespoons (7 g) of cornstarch in a pot. Bring it to a simmer and stir until it thickens into a paste. [14] X Research source Continuously mix the paste to prevent it from sticking to the pot. [15] X Research source After the mask cools, apply it to your hair in sections from the roots to the ends. [16] X Research source Let your hair dry for 20 to 30 minutes before washing with shampoo and conditioner. For best results, apply this mask once a day.

steps.title: Hot oil treatments can naturally nourish and straighten your hair.
steps.content: Hot oil treatments can naturally nourish and straighten your hair. Scoop 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of a plant-based oil (like coconut oil or olive oil) into a heat-safe bowl. Place the bowl in a larger bowl of hot water for 5 minutes. [17] X Research source Test the oil on your wrist to make sure it isn’t too hot. Apply it from your scalp to the ends of your hair. Cover your hair with a plastic shower cap, leave it in for 15 to 30 minutes, and wash with shampoo. For best results, repeat this treatment every other week. Other plant-based oils include grapeseed , almond, hemp seed , castor , or avocado oil . [18] X Research source

steps.title: Add almond oil to your conditioner to give you sleek straight hair.
steps.content: Add almond oil to your conditioner to give you sleek straight hair. Mix 3 to 4 drops of almond oil into the amount of conditioner you normally use at one time. [19] X Research source Condition your hair as normal, then wash it out. Repeat this treatment twice a week. [20] X Research source The vitamins in almond oil can moisturize your curls and may make your hair stronger and straighter. [21] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Rice water can help soften and straighten your hair over time.
steps.content: Rice water can help soften and straighten your hair over time. Soak 1 ⁄ 2 cup (120 ml) of dry, uncooked white rice in 2 cups (470 ml) of water for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Strain the rice and pour the water all over your hair from root to tip. Massage it into your scalp. [22] X Research source Leave the water in for 20 to 30 minutes, then shampoo and condition as usual. Repeat this treatment 1 to 2 times per week. [23] X Research source Rice is loaded with amino acids (the building blocks of proteins, including keratin) that may help strengthen and straighten your hair. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Apple cider vinegar can make your hair shiny and straight.
steps.content: Apple cider vinegar can make your hair shiny and straight. Pour ¼ cup (2 oz) of apple cider vinegar into a spray bottle and fill the rest with water. [25] X Research source Spray your hair with the mixture from your scalp to the ends. [26] X Research source Put on a plastic shower cap and let it sit for 5 minutes. Wash it out with shampoo and conditioner. The acid in apple cider vinegar can help strip away excess oil and dandruff, making your hair softer, silkier, shinier, and straighter. [27] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Avoid using apple cider vinegar straight. Always dilute it with water and do a skin patch test before applying it to larger areas. [28] X Research source

steps.title: Straightening shampoos can help weigh your hair down.
steps.content: Straightening shampoos can help weigh your hair down. Look for straightening shampoos with ingredients like guar hydroxypropyltrimonium chloride and quaternium 80 to help condition and smooth your hair. [29] X Research source These shampoos contain silicones, polymers, and other conditioning agents that can weigh down your hair and reduce curling or frizzing. [30] X Research source Straightening shampoos won’t straighten your hair, but they can provide protection from heat styling tools and make your hair shiner and less frizzy. [31] X Research source Use smoothing sprays or hair serums made for straight or sleek hair to help tame your locks.

steps.title: Pin your damp hair to your head to straighten it while you sleep.
steps.content: Pin your damp hair to your head to straighten it while you sleep. After showering, comb out a section of hair and pull it flat around the back of your head. Secure the section with bobby pins . [32] X Research source Repeat this process until you wrap all your hair. Let it dry completely before removing the pins. Wrap a silk scarf or satin bonnet to protect your hair from frizzing while you sleep. Wrapping your hair keeps your locks straight while they dry so they can’t develop curls or tangles overnight. To keep kinks and curls away more effectively, apply a setting lotion before you sleep.

steps.title: Roll your damp hair in 3 in (7.6 cm) plastic or magnetic rollers.
steps.content: Roll your damp hair in 3 in (7.6 cm) plastic or magnetic rollers . Comb out a section of your hair the same width as the roller. Place the roller at the bottom of the section and apply tension as you roll it up. [33] X Research source Clip the rollers with bobby pins and repeat this process until all your hair is rolled up. Let your hair dry completely before taking the rollers out. Sleep with the rollers in overnight to give your hair a smooth, straight, voluminous look. [34] X Research source Rollers are traditionally used to curl hair, however, 3 in (7.6 cm) rollers are large enough to have the opposite effect and keep curly hair from coiling naturally.

steps.title: Tie multiple scrunchies along your hair to straighten it while it dries.
steps.content: Tie multiple scrunchies along your hair to straighten it while it dries. Gather your damp hair into 1 or 2 low tight ponytails with silk scrunchies . Place scrunchies close together along both ponytails, leaving no space between them. [35] X Research source Wait for your hair to dry completely before removing the scrunchies. [36] X Research source Placing scrunchies along your ponytails can keep them straight, preventing your hair from curling up while it dries. Try to tie the scrunchies loose enough so they don’t kink your hair, but tight enough so they won’t slide out.

steps.title: Salon treatments get rid of curls but also pose health risks.
steps.content: Salon treatments get rid of curls but also pose health risks. While straightening treatments aren’t completely permanent, they can be effective for a few months. [37] X Research source Japanese straight perms are permanent treatments that only require touch-ups every 6 months as new hair grows in. [38] X Research source The process involves a chemical treatment to break the bonds in your hair and another plus heat application to restructure the bonds as straight hair. [39] X Research source These treatments usually use ammonium thioglycolate, which could damage your hair or cause allergic reactions. [40] X Research source Keratin treatments or “Brazilian blowouts” are semi-permanent techniques that won’t give you pin-straight hair, but can help reduce curls and frizz for 3 to 5 months. [41] X Research source These treatments involve brushing your hair with a cream made with formaldehyde, which can irritate your skin. [42] X Research source It’s also been linked to various cancers. [43] X Trustworthy Source National Cancer Institute An agency in the National Institutes of Health focused on cancer research and patient support Go to source
